intro: Phyllanthus brachycladus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant.
